posts.content:
Hi,

What have you Guys and Girls got in the place of the original Easicool in your Devon's?

I have been looking online for ages but cannot seem to find an electric or gas fridge to fit the space. I have even considered fitting a modern evaporator/condenser to the original easicool, but do not feel the old unit would be in keeping with my new interior.

Any ideas or suggestion would be really welcome.

Wayne

Well I for one spent ages restoring mine so it would look like it did originally.
Easicool fridges with the drip tray and drain hole through floor and belly pan...do work after a fashion.
If you want a modern fridge it may be possible to take the interior out of a modern electric powered one and fit it into a home made insulated box with the same door design size.
You could make the box deeper to go further under the seat..
But off the shelf....I have only ever seen one microfridge in that position but it did not look good.
Bus is 1960 61 62 ?
The easicool you show has a non standard door catch and missing the easicool badge.
If it were mine I would be restoring that..checking chalk for cracks and repairing
Remaking the frame
Covering the door
Getting a scanned badge
Sorting the handle
Must have a drip tray and drain to work though..
G

Hi G,

It is a 1960 built registered in 61

I think you are very mistaken it is most defiantly the original handle and catch, the catch is built into the metal work of the cooler and it has not been tampered with and it also looks the same as the 1960 catalogue you have published in another forum, the badge is also attached if you look at the photo closely, it has just faded with age.

viewtopic.php?f=46&t=110831

Yes...
Looking on phone..
Keep and enjoy...
But I am a declared Keep it stock...man

Will look great..
G

I have a spare easicool with that catch / knob on too which was originally with a 60/61 interior.

I'd originally assumed it was incorrect but now it seems it's just a slightly earlier model so thanks for this info.

I researched this topic a few years ago and at that time there was an off the shelf camping fridge with a separate box and compressor. Possibly made by Waeco and rather expensive. It wouldn't fit into the hole in its standard form but would fit under the seat as a dump fridge I seem to remember.

I cannot see on the posts of the early (easicool) brochures BUT I will examine..
I have to say that my knowledge was based on examining 1964, 1965 and 1966 examples of easicool fridges..
I have/ had three, now have two, both from 1965 MY Devon Caravettes.
Gave one LHD other in a disassembled state to Rippers......

I have only seen handles on doors with push button catches.....

Later doors had black plastic inset handles and pull magnetic catches.

Bay Devon conversion buses with easicool have a chromed quadrant handle.
I also have seen a black plastic knob with a crescent base and I assumed this was an addition.

But I never got to see how it attached and closed..

As they say....

Every day is a school day..

I only know the push button catch..

My new interior?
New to the bus?
New made?
New trimmed out?
New in what way?
Can see that the front seat lower panel closing upright is correct for year before water tank was fitted there with whale pump.

There would have been a hole in the floor to take the drain spout of the easicool tray.

On later Devon there is a shaped very thin ply closing panel with square beading edge on tge RHS fitted there sitting at the back across to the edge of the upright cupboard with a screw into the cupboard and a screw through from the front face of the upright.
On my 64 this has a black domed cap on it. Do you have this and the holes?

This was to stop items under the seat "wicking" and getting wet by being against the back of the easicool and absorbing water out of the wet chalk block.
I will examine brochures I have to attempt to see the handle.

63MY brochure new to me...



The best picture I have of a 62 is this one but as to date I have no info...



Checked on DVLA....LOL
GSK 560
First registered 12th April 1962
Another sister for Sherry and clymoj!!!!!


Any photos of the latch catch on the door?

Later easicool doors have a push button catch..like this...



Have seen the weaco internals used to fit a purpose made box fridge.
Thread on thesamba.com showing fitting to a Westfalia fridge. Sure this could be done with internals behind the box under the seat more...

http://www.thesamba.com/vw/forum/viewto ... c&start=80

My handle is a funky 60s drawer style number that appears to have been recycled from whatever was around at the time. The door is original, as the Formica appears to be, and it's attached on the rear by door card cups and screws. I have seen a few others like this and assumed they weren't OG, but with this one also maybe, like all other things Devon, they just used whatever was on hand.

That style of handle ....was marketted by easicool as one their later models..? dare I say it....
Fitted by Devon to Early bay?
Exactly the same but with a drawer handle and cupboard fitting...
Still perfectly usable....

By "new interior" I meant soft furniture eg new leather door cards/cushions and head lining ect.

The Devon cabinetry is original to my bus and was very well intact, it was only missing its sink but I have had a new one fitted and all the units polished, the bus was a real survivor, coming with all its bits like awning, easicooler and what look like an original gas fire or at least the rite time era.

But this going complete of the topic of what I was asking.

I would personally keep the easicool over a modern unit; it's keeping with the interior as it's how Devon intended, and I don't know if a modern fridge would suit, maybe it would. However if you'd like something a bit more contemporary, install the modern evaporator/condenser in the easicool, unscrew the door and refit a bit of MDF covered in your door card leather with a nice chrome handle. Or something glossy, or patterned, whatever veneer you like really. Would look smart and you can always change it back if you want to go back to stock.

I have the same handle on mine in my '66

From the colour and the handle...It is marginally later from the Bay period.
The handle was original to Easicool just slightly later.1968?
Easicool are fragile and they are basically a chalk box..which can shatter...
